Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery small open vessel, probably kylix; interior: glazed streaky brown, possibly banded; exterior, from top: minimal trace of upper frieze; dot-band frieze between lines; black-figure warrior frieze: on left, front of head including eye, right forearm and hand holding spear of warrior to right; in centre, bearded warrior with circles for pectorals and added red on middle part of torso, running left with right hand outstretched and left hand raised holding weapon; on right, rim of shield of third figure, and shafts of two spears in dilute; incised splinter rosette as filling ornament.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 118, no. A201)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.080) (Phase 1)
